file_content.text: You have done very well. Lord Zash will be proud.
What acolytes learn on Korriban is just the bare form of being Sith. It is not enough for greatness.
At long last, Lord Zash's apprentice. May you soon gain the honors you so well deserve.
On Korriban, you earned the right to be called Sith. But that was only the beginning. Your master wishes me to oversee your continued training.
I am willing to learn whatever you have to teach.
I'm honored.
Lord Zash said you were a good student and a fast learner.
The fool Harkun had nothing to teach me, and neither do you.
You are nothing to me.
We'll let Lord Zash judge what you have to learn, and who from.
Someday I will rule the Sith. There is no limit to my strength.
I know what I can achieve.
From all I've heard from Lord Zash, I believe it.
Lord Zash embraces the search for dark artifacts and secrets. Others choose the martial path, channeling their anger into physical strength. You, too, must find your path.
I prefer not to limit myself.
Only one aspect?
It's Lord Zash's wish that you choose.
I wish to master the art of the lightsaber.
I want to be a fighter.
I want to learn the secrets of the dark side.
I want to study the Force.
Think it over. Speak to Overseer Kryos when you are ready to begin your training in earnest.
I'm sorry. I'm very busy right now.
